definition: (of a power plant, refinery etc) to shut down
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
to stop/to halt/to park (a car)

sentences.english: Google can shut down its phone manufacturing operations, or sell it off.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌可以关停手机生产部门，或是再次将其出售。

sentences.english: Stopping the Operation of "Five Kinds of Small Plants".
sentences.chinese: 控制总量和关停“五小”工作取得进展。

sentences.english: Agents barged in and shut down production.
sentences.chinese: 探员们闯入工厂并关停了生产线。

sentences.english: You must answer multiple choice questions to deactivate the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 你必须回答多项选择题才能关停闹铃。

sentences.english: Since Mr Yang ignored the order, the school’s water and electricity have been cut off.
sentences.chinese: 因为杨校长无视政府关停令，该校目前已被断水断电。

sentences.english: Operation of "Five Kinds of Small Plants".
sentences.chinese: 控制总量和关停“五小”工作取得进展。

sentences.english: That was shut down by lawsuits from the record companies.
sentences.chinese: 而后者因为唱片公司的诉讼而早被关停了。

definition: to suppress/to crack down on/to prohibit
to reform/to rectify and improve
to cease trading (temporarily or permanently)/to close down
to stop production
to change production/to move over to new products
to go bankrupt/to close down
to tear down/to demolish/to dismantle/to remove
coal burning boiler
to stop work/to shut down/to stop production
production capacity
to delist (a traded security)/(sports) to accept a transfer-listed player from another club
to move/to relocate/removal
to drain sewage
coal fuel
to take down from the shelves (e.g. a contaminated product)
to sequester/to seize (assets)/to seal up/to close down
